content:
We need an Editor to take on these three pages which have been started but need some work to complete. It should not be that difficult to do as the layer concepts are simple. We had an Editor for this but he has not produced anything., so now we need someone who will finish this small project.

Manage Routes > Layer Tab
Manage Routes > Layer Properties
Manage Routes > Use Layer

Thank you

@Rick Gleason The links to Layer Properties and Use Layer in your request don't work. Are there old copies somewhere? Use Layer has moved to Advanced, which is fine for what it contains. Should there be something that briefly describes why one would want to use layers?
I'm going to take a cut at the Layers section. Some of the buttons don't do anything on my 5.9 install on MacOS. I'll check it out on a Windows machine I have.

Terry, that's great. I am here by Zulip or email, if you have questions or need help.
There is just one page Layers Tab I think the older screenshots towards the end might be ok, but you should check.

@Rick Gleason I've built two draft pages for Layers. Layers Tab and Use Layers under STAGING, mirroring what exists for the other elements of Routes. I could build a Layer Properties page that shows the difference in the properties for routes, tracks, and waypoints but that seems like overkill.
Could you take a look and comment? TODO: get newer screenshots to better match the text.
What do you think about renaming the Use Layers page in Advanced to something like "Creating Layers".
@Terry Slattery There's a bit of info re: Layers in Navigation Sharing that would be relevant. I guess an important point is that Layers are not editable, like Routes, Tracks or Waypoints.

@John Morfit Thanks for the tip on the Layers info in Navigation Data Backup. I also found info in Use GPX Files. I've added a link to Use Layers for each of these pages. I also couldn't identify anything that Layers Tab > List Contents does on Windows 11. I updated Layers Tab with that note.
